image.altText: A blonde woman smiling and holding a goat.

props.synopsis: Devastated family members were unaware she had even left the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital unit when they were told the much loved 41-year old's body had been found on a beach, north of Brisbane.

title.children: Angie was discharged from a mental health unit without support â€” days later she took her own life

image.altText: Rubbish at the site, viewed through a wire fence.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation has found the 180-hectare property on the Fraser Coast, marketed as part of an "eco-development", has become an alleged pollution time bomb, after being used to illegally dump more than 35,000 tonnes of waste.

title.children: Former Bandido bikie associate left to contain massive alleged illegal toxic waste dump

image.altText: A handful of uniform soldiers stand on top of two military tanks in bushland

props.synopsis: Twelve injured Singaporean servicemen are airlifted by military helicopter to Rockhampton Hospital, after a collision during Exercise Wallaby at training area at Shoalwater Bay.

title.children: Two tanks collide during major international military training exercise in Central Queensland

image.altText: A drone shot of rainforest next to beaches

props.synopsis: The 7.8-kilometre dual mountain biking and hiking route winds through rainforest from Palm Cove Jetty to the Ellis Beach foreshore, north of Cairns.

title.children: Queensland's newest trail following ancient trade and travel routes opens

image.altText: a man in police uniform

props.synopsis: Steve Gollschewski says he has ordered that no records be destroyed as Queensland Police Service combs its archives to share with the inquiry.

title.children: Queensland police commissioner says records of notorious Native Police will be shared with truth-telling inquiry

image.altText: A double rainbow stretches over the sand and palm trees at the beach known as The Strand in Townsville.

props.synopsis: A multi-million dollar plan for paid parking at Townsville's The Strand, one of North Queensland's most popular tourist hot spots, is creating a furore in the tropical city.Â

title.children: Fury builds over plans for paid parking along iconic Queensland beachfront

image.altText: A photo of James Maloney with a ball.

props.synopsis: The former North Queensland Cowboys assistant coach has been fined after drink driving in Townsville. He was sacked from the club on the eve of the NRL finals.

title.children: Sacked Cowboys assistant coach James Maloney pleads guilty to drink driving

image.altText: Black sign reading "coal mine here? save our farms" pitched into dry grassland

props.synopsis: After the Supreme Court set aside the initial rejection of Fox Resources' application, the state government looks likely to refuse the mining application again.

title.children: Queensland government says food bowl coal mine not in public interest, for a second time

image.altText: A woman in a purple jacket with large silver buttons sitting in an office chair.

props.synopsis: Linzi Wilson-Wilde has submitted a business case to the state government for a new building, which she says could be constructed on the existing precinct.

title.children: Forensic Science Queensland boss calls for $450m replacement of scandal-plagued DNA lab

image.altText: An aerial view of the site for the proposed development next to the M1 on the Gold Coast.

props.synopsis: The Queensland government has given the green light for 2,750 homes to be built on a Gold Coast flood plain. The council says the suburb's roads and other infrastructure won't cope with the increased density.

title.children: Backlash over plans to build thousands of homes on Gold Coast flood plain

image.altText: A mines rescue worker throws out a hose as fire burns in the background.

props.synopsis: From mine collapses, evacuation efforts and underground infernos, these dedicated mine rescue teams put their lives on the line for fallen colleagues â€” and they do it for free.

title.children: The mining industry 'Black Ops' tasked with entering dangerous, life-threatening situations

image.altText: Elham is hugging her two daughters. She is wearing a white hijab.

props.synopsis: Australia's Lebanese community is mourning family members killed by Israeli air strikes in southern Lebanon.Â

title.children: 'Why the children?': Lebanese Australian community heartbroken and angry over Israel's attack

image.altText: Bass player from Powderfinger John Collins standing outside a music venue in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Powderfinger legend John "JC" Collins has been appointed to the new role of Queensland Night-Life Economy Commissioner, tasked with the job of reviving the state's struggling nightlife scene.

title.children: Queensland hires Powderfinger legend to revive state's nightlife scene

image.altText: Street scene of suburb with police cars.

props.synopsis: A woman appears in court charged with murder after the discovery of a body outside a home in inner Cairns.

title.children: Woman, 25, faces court charged with murder after 67yo found dead in Cairns

image.altText: Portraits of nine women looking serious are arranged in a grid.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australian women who won a landmark class action settlement more than a year ago over damage done by pelvic mesh have still not received any compensation.

title.children: Women in pelvic mesh class action feel 'ripped off' by legal process

image.altText: A woman holding a young child.

props.synopsis: Medicare is now covering just over half of specialist fees, forcing Australians to increasingly dip into their own pockets and delay vital care.

title.children: Experts warn Medicare rebates for specialists 'almost meaningless'

image.altText: A man in a light blue singlet sitting in front of plants.

props.synopsis: Over the weekend Perry Kouroumblis was arrested in Rome in connection to the 1977 Easey Street murders. It was news that left his friend Phil Akers 'dumbfounded'.Â

title.children: Friend 'dumbfounded' by arrest of Perry Kouroumblis over Easey Street murders

image.altText: A weather map of Australia showing temperature changes for the week

props.synopsis: While parts of Australia's east coast are forecast for warm weather, a cold polar air mass is expected to bring rain and temperature declines of up to 20 degrees Celsius across the continent's south-east before the end of the week.

title.children: Polar air mass and cloudband expected to bring rain and temperature falls of up to 20C for east coast

image.altText: Joe Biden stands in front of a green wall and holds up a hand.

props.synopsis: The outgoing US president's speech to the UN General Assembly steps through a litany of devastating conflicts and existential challenges plaguing the globe, but offers some hope for a way forward.

title.children: Biden says world faces 'inflection point in history' as he offers leadership lesson at the UN

image.altText: A crowd of out-of-focus people walk in front of a large in-focus Coles supermarket sign.

props.synopsis: You can't have missed the parade of political figures this year lining up to take a kick at the nation's biggest supermarket chains, Coles and Woolworths, who jointly control about 65 per cent of the grocery market.

title.children: Politicians line up to kick Coles and Woolworths before an electionâ€” but they can tend to score own goals

image.altText: Carl Ditterich leaving court

props.synopsis: Carl Ditterich is facing court accused of sexually assaulting a teenage girl in 1985, when he was aged 39. He denies the allegations,

title.children: Teenager's diary entry referencing former AFL great could be key evidence in sexual assault trial

image.altText: An elaborate Chinese dragon in bright colours being paraded on a street, a few dragon carriers visible around it

props.synopsis: Two of Bendigo's Golden Dragons were vandalised earlier this year. In the wake of the heartbreak, we tell the remarkable story of how the third dragon came to be.

title.children: A small Victorian town is home to the worldâ€™s longest Golden Dragons. This is how to build one

image.altText: James Lindesay and Joyce Schirrman sit on arm chairs wearing Sydney Swans scarfs.

props.synopsis: Ninety years ago, James Lindesay was heading to watch South Melbourne play on the banks of Melbourne's Albert Park Lake. This Saturday, he and his sister will be praying for a premiership.

title.children: Two non-Victorian teams are vying for the AFL premiership, but their roots to the state still run deep

image.altText: a woman in a white suit in the House of Reps smiling

props.synopsis: The federal government says the extensions will secure the jobs of more than 1,800 workers, but the move has angered environmentalists who have described the decision as "the opposite of climate action".

title.children: Three NSW coal mines to be extended for another 30 to 40 years after federal government approval

image.altText: Reserve Bank of Australia generic

props.synopsis: The RBA has kept interest rates on hold at 4.35 per cent despite political pressure to lower it.

title.children: Reserve Bank keeps interest rates on hold at 4.35pc, ignoring political pressure for cut

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Police have renewed their search in the case of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy, with efforts set to continue on Wednesday.

title.children: Police launch fresh search in case of missing Ballarat woman Samantha Murphy

image.altText: A woman with braided red hair kneels and embraces a young boy with blonde hair who looks upset.

props.synopsis: The rate of psychiatric medication prescribed to Australian children and teenagers has more than doubled in the past 10 years, according to new government data.

title.children: Stimulant prescriptions for kids nearly quadruple in 10 years, as 'mental health crisis' grows

image.altText: A man holds a large knife and looks at the camera with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Teenagers in England and Wales are twice as likely to be killed by a knife now than they were 10 years ago and as violent knife crime continues to rise the UK takes measures like a buy-back scheme similar to Australia's after the Port Arthur massacre.

title.children: UK authorities want these 'zombie knives' off the streets and they're hoping something borrowed from Australia will help

image.altText: Uluru waterfalls

props.synopsis: A rare spring northwest cloudband delivers record rain to parts of outback Australia. The weather event is now moving southeast towards Sydney.

title.children: Rain records broken near Uluru as major cloudband moves towards eastern states

image.altText: Palmer pic

props.synopsis: The federal government is close to announcing an electoral reform proposal likely to provoke teal independents and trigger a legal challenge from Clive Palmer.

title.children: Government sets crosshairs on 'billionaire' political donors, including teal backers

image.altText: a group of soldiers wearing camouflage stepping from the shore onto a beach

props.synopsis: As US military presence ramps up in the north, experts say one of Australia's closest Asian neighbours is growing wary that the US's expanded presence could bring rising tensions to the region.

title.children: Growing US military build-up in Australia's north concerning Indonesia

image.altText: A black and white photo of a comet. It has a huge tail.

props.synopsis: Comet C/2023 A3 (Tsuchinshan-ATLAS) is bright enough to be seen in the early morning sky with just your eyes. But only if you know when and where to look.

title.children: This comet is shaping up to be the best one this year. Here's how to spot it

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.Â

props.synopsis: Victorian Liberal leader John Pesutto called for the expulsion of rookie MP Moira Deeming after her attendance at an anti-trans-rights rally to protect his party from reputational damage, a court has heard.

title.children: 'It was time to act': Victorian Liberal leader had 'grave' concerns about party's reputation after MP's appearance at anti-trans-rights rally

image.altText: Tony Armstrong wearing a white T shirt and a denim jacket.

props.synopsis: Popular ABC presenter and Gold Logie nominee Tony Armstrong announces he will leave ABC News Breakfast in October. Tony will return to ABC screens in 2025 hosting a new show to be announced later.Â

title.children: Tony Armstrong announces departure from ABC News Breakfast to host new show
